text: This is one of the all time classics, and, infact, the strip that started me reading Achewood!

text: Gettin your bone on six times is a touch of class.

text:
He was like...

name: hurfusdurfus
text:
i did not mean to lame you.

in fact, i meant to chubby you.

in fact, i meant to chubby because no one else had.

this is tragic and i am sorry.

name: cousinted
text: Enough, all is forgiven. Now we drink! We feast! We spit on face of death for another day!

name: zapatos
text:
Yes! YES!!!

I am lacking the words to properly convey how much I want to join this celebration.

name: edwell
text: This cannot be chubbied enough.

name: mortshire
text: everybody do the bone dance, BONE BONE BONE.

name: chaesar
text: I love the face Beef makes when he is not in the mood for something.

name: alejandroadam
text:
me and my brother still do this to eachother (I got my bone on like six-time BONE BONE). the hand twirl in the last frame is optional.

also. the "I'm ten-kinds-of ____" is gold.

name: nicolae
text: Astute readers will notice that it is the same twirling paw-motion Ray teaches Little Nephew when he wants to get his Bone on.  Well played.

name: farqussus
text: are you congratulating yourself being 'an astute reader'?

name: syrinx
text: Even this early on, we see some subtle hints of Pat's homosexuality.  Very nicely done.

name: rowboat
text: Pat has become Pat. But I forgot that he did so before Beef became Beef.

name: greenkoolayd
text: au contraire, i see them as subtle hints of pats dickitude, rather than homosexuality.  especially considering that his homosexuality suddenly manifests itself.  its not as if it happens gradually.  he just wakes up one day, craving another dudes erect penis.

name: fuckyoufriday
text: Warm weather is just right for getting your Bone on.

name: farqussus
text:
Ray was going to respond with exactly that no matter what Pat said.

"I need new tires."

"You're tellin' me!...

name: deancain29
text: Wrong - Ray is class. word.

name: nurdbot
text:
BONE! BONE! BONE!

This one gets stuck in my head, all the time.

name: spectre
text: Alt text: "Sorry mom, sorry dad, sorry college." The college would be Stanford.

text: That alt text is my life.

text: Snotfrad needs no sympathy.

text: I think that alt text on pretty much a daily basis.

text: Actually I think not. Pat's assholicity seems to germinate during the "...BONED?" story arc.

text: Ya he is, just check out his bio .

text: Encouraged by Teodor's interest, Ray's pantomiming of boning intensifies to include a spinning of the left arm in panel 6.

text: I have had so many days like that.  Unfortunately, none of them have been recently.

text: Six times?

text: The first 5 I have given.  Truly perfect.

name: shoinan
text: Like Ray, I give it 6.

name: helenthebum
text:
i think this really was onstad's way of apologizing to the world for giving birth to the genius that is ray n the gang

ps this is my favorite strip

name: unsentletter
text: The alt-text stiff-armed me into giving this a five-out-of-five.  Brilliant.

name: coco
text: Everybody dance like there's bone in your pants! Do the bone dance!

name: snowman
text: Ray is drawn just beautifully here.

name: lux
text: He raises one leg when boning...? Panels 3 and 4 are a little perplexing. does he... does he dance from foot to foot, effortlessly boning?

name: farqussus
text: His boning dance bears considerable resemblance to the Running Man.

name: nabeel84
text: Someone has never done it doggy style.

name: wurlitzergirl
text: haha. One of the best ever.

name: seanbateman
text: This strip and Beef's tendency to say "such as" are the Achewood speech manerisms that have bled into my life the most.

name: seph
text: Bone. A verb so important it requires improper capitalization.

name: elscoob
text: I don't think this was the first Achewood I read, but it was the first one where I knew without a doubt that I would love Achewood forever.

text:

name: especial
text: This animation has made me so happy.

name: robot_satan
text: So, today my little brother was playing Spyro: Year of the Dragon on our old PS1, and there was a skeleton that, upon retrieval of his missing peices, danced a jig refered to as his "Bone Dance".  I immediately thought of this.

name: zapatos
text: I do it too Ray, I do it too.

name: taskmaster
text: This strip is classic. I always got the feeling that Ray would continue to tell this "bone" story until he had found a suitably appreciative audience.
